content: The "Parkinson's Research Act of 1997" aims to expand federal investment in Parkinson's research and improve coordination among National Institutes of Health research institutes. It also seeks to enhance care and assistance for individuals with Parkinson's and their family caregivers. The "Parkinson's Research Act of 1997" amends the Public Health Service Act to focus on Parkinson's disease research. The Director of NIH will establish a program for Parkinson's disease research and training, coordinating with national research institutes and holding research planning conferences every two years.
